text.p: Italian debt intruments closed lower but made up a bit of ground after an easier start in a dull session of range-trading, lacking direction from the U.S. with markets there closed for Thanksgiving Day, traders said.

Btp futures, feeling the weight of a 10-year Btp auction this morning, recovered a touch on the rise of Bund futures which set a new record high on Liffe but were unable to benefit fully despite the lira firming to a new historic high against the mark of 986.65.
"Btps continued to stay in range, perhaps consolidating on recent highs," one trader said.

The December Liffe Btp slipped through support at 127.50 this morning but moved up again only to meet resistance around 128.00. December rolls over into March on Wednesday. March ended 8 bps off at 126.90. "The roll-over's going pretty smoothly after some volatility Wednesday," one trader said.
Traders noted there was no great enthusiasm over the Btp and Cct auctions. The Btps were assigned at a price of 104.05 against a previous 104.60 and the Ccts at 100.95 from 101.35.
On the interbank market. the overnight rate was at an average 8.02 percent against 8.13 but tom/next rose to an average 8.22 from 8.13 percent.
